applicationProcess.question: Can I apply if I don't go to UWaterloo?
applicationProcess.answer: If you’re a university student who will be residing in the city of Waterloo, you’re welcome to apply! However, we do give priority to UW students.

applicationProcess.question: Can I be a part of Blueprint while on a work term?
applicationProcess.answer: Yes, we are happy to take students on both academic and work terms.

applicationProcess.question: I don't have a lot of dev or design experience, should I still apply?
applicationProcess.answer: Yes! Blueprint is a great way to gain more experience as you will be surrounded by a community of peers with varying expertise in different fields who can mentor and support you. We care more about your ability to learn and your passion for social good.

aboutOurTeam.question: How do you choose projects?
aboutOurTeam.answer: Nonprofits can apply to work with us through our website or we reach out to organizations nominated by our members. After consulting with them, we determine whether their proposed project is a good fit for our team. Read more on our Nonprofits page.

aboutOurTeam.question: Do I get to choose which project I work on?
aboutOurTeam.answer: Before the term begins, our designers and developers have a chance to get to know the upcoming projects. They then fill out information about their skills and preferences in our selection form so that project leads and project managers can choose their teams accordingly. We always strive to get everyone their top choices, but no guarantees can be made.

aboutOurTeam.question: How does mentorship work in Blueprint?
aboutOurTeam.answer: We organize our project teams so they have an even distribution of developer experience. That way, if you’re just starting out, you’ll always have someone you can turn to for help! For designers, there are weekly design meetings where members can ask each other for feedback.

aboutOurTeam.question: What's the time commitment? How many hours per week will I spend on Blueprint?
aboutOurTeam.answer: We would like our members to contribute around 10 hours per week to ensure that we can deliver high-quality products to the organizations we partner with. We understand it’s a big commitment, so make sure your course load and other extracurriculars will allow for it.
